title: RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (30) : unknown error at /pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCGeneral.cpp:70
body_html:
Issue description

$ python pytorch.py 
THCudaCheck FAIL file=/pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCGeneral.cpp line=70 error=30 : unknown error
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "pytorch.py", line 3, in <module>
    a = torch.ones(3,3).to('cuda')
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 161, in _lazy_init
    torch._C._cuda_init()
RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (30) : unknown error at /pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCGeneral.cpp:70

Code example

import torch

a = torch.ones(3,3).to('cuda')
b = torch.ones(3,3).to('cuda')

print(a + b)

System Info

$ python collect_env.py 
Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.1.85

OS: Arch Linux
GCC version: (GCC) 8.1.0
CMake version: Could not collect

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: 9.2.88
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 970
Nvidia driver version: 396.24
cuDNN version: Could not collect

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip3] numpy (1.14.3)
[pip3] numpydoc (0.7.0)
[pip3] torch (0.4.0)
[pip3] torchvision (0.2.1)
[conda] Could not collect

collect_env.py does not detect cuDNN even though it's installed:

# pacman -Q | egrep 'cud(a|nn)'
cuda 9.2.88.1-2
cudnn 7.1.3-1
pycuda-headers 2017.1.1-5
python-pycuda 2017.1.1-5
python-tensorflow-opt-cuda 1.8.0-2

body:
## Issue description

```
$ python pytorch.py 
THCudaCheck FAIL file=/pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCGeneral.cpp line=70 error=30 : unknown error
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "pytorch.py", line 3, in <module>
    a = torch.ones(3,3).to('cuda')
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 161, in _lazy_init
    torch._C._cuda_init()
RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (30) : unknown error at /pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCGeneral.cpp:70
```

## Code example

```
import torch

a = torch.ones(3,3).to('cuda')
b = torch.ones(3,3).to('cuda')

print(a + b)
```

## System Info

```
$ python collect_env.py 
Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.1.85

OS: Arch Linux
GCC version: (GCC) 8.1.0
CMake version: Could not collect

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: 9.2.88
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 970
Nvidia driver version: 396.24
cuDNN version: Could not collect

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip3] numpy (1.14.3)
[pip3] numpydoc (0.7.0)
[pip3] torch (0.4.0)
[pip3] torchvision (0.2.1)
[conda] Could not collect
```

`collect_env.py` does not detect `cuDNN` even though it's installed:

```
# pacman -Q | egrep 'cud(a|nn)'
cuda 9.2.88.1-2
cudnn 7.1.3-1
pycuda-headers 2017.1.1-5
python-pycuda 2017.1.1-5
python-tensorflow-opt-cuda 1.8.0-2
```
